00045 #define idx_check_contiguous1(src0)                             \
00046   if (!(src0).contiguousp())                                    \
00047     ylerror("Idx must be contiguous\n");
00048 
00050 #define idx_check_contiguous2(src0, src1)                               \
00051   if (!(src0).contiguousp() || !(src1).contiguousp())                   \
00052     ylerror("Idx must be contiguous\n");
00053 
00055 #define idx_checknelems2_all(src0, src1)                                \
00056   if ((src0).nelements() != (src1).nelements())                         \
00057     ylerror("incompatible Idx sizes\n");
00058 
00060 #define idx_checknelems3_all(src0, src1, src2)          \
00061   if (((src0).nelements() != (src1).nelements()) ||     \
00062       ((src0).nelements() != (src2).nelements()))       \
00063     ylerror("incompatible Idx sizes\n");
00064 
00066 #define idx_checkorder1(src0, o0)               \
00067   if ((src0).order() != o0)                     \
00068     ylerror("Idx has wrong order");
00069 
00071 #define idx_checkorder2(src0, o0, src1, o1)             \
00072   if (((src0).order() != o0) || ((src1).order() != o1)) \
00073     ylerror("Idx have incompatible orders");
00074 
00076 #define idx_checkorder3(src0, o0, src1, o1, src2, o2)                   \
00077   if (((src0).order() != o0) || ((src1).order() != o1)                  \
00078       || ((src2).order() != o2))                                        \
00079     ylerror("Idx have incompatible orders");
00080 
00082 #define idx_checkorder3_all(src0, src1, src2)                           \
00083   if (((src0).order() != (src1).order())                                \
00084       || ((src0).order() != (src2).order()))                            \
00085     ylerror("Idx have incompatible orders");
00086 
00088 #define idx_checkdim2(src0, d0, e0, src1, d1, e1)       \
00089   if (((src0).dim(d0) != e0) || ((src1).dim(d1) != e1)) \
00090     ylerror("Idx have incompatible dimensions");
00091 
00093 #define idx_checkdim2_all(src0, src1, d)                \
00094   if ((src0).dim(d) != (src1).dim(d))                   \
00095     ylerror("Idx have incompatible dimensions");
00096 
00098 #define idx_checkdim3_all(src0, src1, src2, d)          \
00099   if (((src0).dim(d) != (src1).dim(d)) ||               \
00100       ((src0).dim(d) != (src2).dim(d)))                 \
00101     ylerror("Idx have incompatible dimensions");
00102 
00105 #define idx_checkdim4_all(src0, src1, src2, src3, d)    \
00106   if (((src0).dim(d) != (src1).dim(d)) ||               \
00107       ((src0).dim(d) != (src2).dim(d)) ||               \
00108       ((src0).dim(d) != (src3).dim(d)))                 \
00109     ylerror("Idx have incompatible dimensions");
00110 
00112   // TODO: these macros are untested (YLC)
00113 
00134 #define cidx1_bloop1(i,p0,src0)                                 \
00135   if ((src0).order() < 1) ylerror("Idx has wrong order");       \
00136   intg _n0 = (src0).dim(0), _m0 = (src0).mod(0);                \
00137   for (i=0, p0=(src0).idx_ptr(); i<_n0; i++, p0+=_m0) 
00138 
00139 #define cidx1_bloop2(i,p0,src0,p1,src1)                                 \
00140   if (((src0).order() < 1)||((src1).order() < 1))                       \
00141     ylerror("Idx has wrong order");                                     \
00142   intg _n0 = (src0).dim(0), _m0 = (src0).mod(0); _m1 = (src1).mod(0);   \
00143   idx_checkdim2_all(src0,src1,0)                                        \
00144   for (i=0, p0=(src0).idx_ptr(), p1=(src1).idx_ptr();                   \
00145        i<_n0;                                                           \
00146        i++, p0+=_m0, p1+=_m1) 
00147 
00148 #define cidx1_bloop3(i,p0,src0,p1,src1,p2,src2)                         \
00149   intg _n0 = (src0).dim(0), _m0 = (src0).mod(0);                        \
00150   intg _m1 = (src1).mod(0), _m2 = (src2).mod(0);                        \
00151   idx_checkdim3_all(src0,src1,src2,0)                                   \
00152   for (i=0, p0=(src0).idx_ptr(), p1=(src1).idx_ptr(), p2=(src2).idx_ptr();\
00153        i<_n0;                                                           \
00154        i++, p0+=_m0, p1+=_m1, p2+=_m2) 
00155 
00156 #define cidx1_bloop4(i,p0,src0,p1,src1,p2,src2,p3,src3)                 \
00157   intg _n0 = (src0).dim(0), _m0 = (src0).mod(0), _m1 = (src1).mod(0);   \
00158   intg _m2 = (src2).mod(0), _m3 = (src3).mod(0);                        \
00159   idx_checkdim4_all(src0,src1,src2,src3,0)                              \
00160   for (i=0, p0=(src0).idx_ptr(), p1=(src1).idx_ptr(),                   \
00161          p2=(src2).idx_ptr(), p3=(src3).idx_ptr();                      \
00162        i<_n0;                                                           \
00163        i++, p0+=_m0, p1+=_m1, p2+=_m2, p3+=_m3) 
00164 
00165 #define cidx2_bloop1(i,j,p0,src0)                                       \
00166   if ((src0).order() < 2) ylerror("Idx has wrong order");               \
00167   intg _n00 = (src0).dim(0), _m00 = (src0).mod(0);                      \
00168   intg _n01 = (src0).dim(1), _m01 = (src0).mod(1);                      \
00169   for (i=0, p0=(src0).idx_ptr(); i<_n00; i++, p0+=_m00-_n01*_m01)       \
00170     for (j=0; i<_n01; j++, p0+=_m01) 
00171 
00172 #define cidx2_bloop2(i,j,p0,src0,p1,src1)                               \
00173   if ((src0).order() < 2) ylerror("Idx has wrong order");               \
00174   intg _n00 = (src0).dim(0), _m00 = (src0).mod(0);                      \
00175   intg _n01 = (src0).dim(1), _m01 = (src0).mod(1);                      \
00176   intg _n10 = (src1).dim(0), _m10 = (src1).mod(0);                      \
00177   intg _n11 = (src1).dim(1), _m11 = (src1).mod(1);                      \
00178   idx_checkdim2_all(src0,src1,0)                                        \
00179   idx_checkdim2_all(src0,src1,1)                                        \
00180   for (i=0, p0=(src0).idx_ptr(), p1=(src1).idx_ptr();                   \
00181        i<_n00;                                                          \
00182        i++, p0+=_m00-_n01*_m01, p1+=_m10-_n11*_m11)                     \
00183     for (j=0; i<_n01; j++, p0+=_m01, p1+=_m11) 
00184 
00185 #define cidx2_bloop3(i,j,p0,src0,p1,src1,p2,src2)                       \
00186   if ((src0).order() < 2) ylerror("Idx has wrong order");               \
00187   intg _n00 = (src0).dim(0), _m00 = (src0).mod(0);                      \
00188   intg _n01 = (src0).dim(1), _m01 = (src0).mod(1);                      \
00189   intg _n10 = (src1).dim(0), _m10 = (src1).mod(0);                      \
00190   intg _n11 = (src1).dim(1), _m11 = (src1).mod(1);                      \
00191   intg _n20 = (src2).dim(0), _m20 = (src2).mod(0);                      \
00192   intg _n21 = (src2).dim(1), _m21 = (src2).mod(1);                      \
00193   idx_checkdim3_all(src0,src1,src2,0)                                   \
00194   idx_checkdim3_all(src0,src1,src2,1)                                   \
00195   for (i=0, p0=(src0).idx_ptr(), p1=(src1).idx_ptr(), p2=(src2).idx_ptr(); \
00196        i<_n00;                                                          \
00197        i++, p0+=_m00-_n01*_m01, p1+=_m10-_n11*_m11, p2+=_m20-_n21*_m21) \
00198     for (j=0; i<_n01; j++, p0+=_m01, p1+=_m11, p2+=_m21) 
00199 
00201 
00209 
00210   // bloop/eloop macros
00211 
00212   // Okay, either C++ really suxx0rz or I'm a really st00pid Lisp-head.
00213   // Why can't we define syntax-changing macros like in Lisp? Basically,
00214   // I can't encapsulate the allocation
00215   // of temporary variable for a loop inside the macro, unless
00216   // I define a "begin" macro and an "end" macro. I would like
00217   // to define idx_bloop so I can do:
00218   // idx_bloop2(lm, m, lv, v) { idx_dot(lm,lm,v); }
00219   // but I can't do that because I have to allocate lm and lv
00220   // inside the macro, hence I need to know the type.
00221   // Now the call would be:
00222   // idx_bloop2(lm, m, double, lv, v, double) { idx_dot(lm,lm,v); }
00223   // But that still doesn't quite work because if I declare lm and lv
00224   // then I can't reuse the same symbols for another loop in the same
00225   // scope. The only way out is to force the user to encase every
00226   // bloop call inside braces, or to not reuse the same synbol twice
00227   // for a looping Idx. I thought about generating a mangled name
00228   // but couldn't find a way to make it useful.
00229   // If a macro could define its own scope that would be great.
00230 
00231 #if USING_STL_ITERS == 1
00232 
00233 #define idx_bloop1(dst0,src0,type0)                             \
00234   for ( DimIter<type0> dst0(src0,0); dst0.notdone(); ++dst0)
00235 
00236 #define idx_bloop2(dst0,src0,type0,dst1,src1,type1)     \
00237   idx_checkdim2_all(src0, src1, 0);                     \
00238   DimIter<type0> dst0(src0,0);                          \
00239   DimIter<type1> dst1(src1,0);                          \
00240   for ( ; dst0.notdone(); ++dst0, ++dst1)
00241 
00242 #define idx_bloop3(dst0,src0,type0,dst1,src1,type1,dst2,src2,type2)     \
00243   idx_checkdim3_all(src0, src1, src2, 0);                               \
00244   DimIter<type0> dst0(src0,0);                                          \
00245   DimIter<type1> dst1(src1,0);                                          \
00246   DimIter<type2> dst2(src2,0);                                          \
00247   for ( ; dst0.notdone(); ++dst0, ++dst1, ++dst2)
00248 
00249 #define idx_bloop4(dst0,src0,type0,dst1,src1,type1,dst2,src2,type2,     \
00250                    dst3,src3,type3)                                     \
00251   idx_checkdim4_all(src0, src1, src2, src3, 0);                         \
00252   DimIter<type0> dst0(src0,0);                                          \
00253   DimIter<type1> dst1(src1,0);                                          \
00254   DimIter<type2> dst2(src2,0);                                          \
00255   DimIter<type3> dst3(src3,0);                                          \
00256   for ( ; dst0.notdone(); ++dst0, ++dst1, ++dst2, ++dst3)
00257 
00258   // eloop macros
00259 
00260 #define idx_eloop1(dst0,src0,type0)             \
00261   DimIter<type0> dst0(src0,src0.order()-1);     \
00262   for ( ; dst0.notdone(); ++dst0)
00263 
00264 #define idx_eloop2(dst0,src0,type0,dst1,src1,type1)                     \
00265   if ((src0).dim((src0).order() - 1) != (src1).dim((src1).order() - 1)) \
00266     ylerror("incompatible Idxs for eloop\n");                           \
00267   DimIter<type0> dst0(src0,(src0).order()-1);                           \
00268   DimIter<type1> dst1(src1,(src1).order()-1);                           \
00269   for ( ; dst0.notdone(); ++dst0, ++dst1)
00270 
00271 #define idx_eloop3(dst0,src0,type0,dst1,src1,type1,dst2,src2,type2)     \
00272   if (((src0).dim((src0).order() - 1) != (src1).dim((src1).order() - 1)) \
00273       || ((src0).dim((src0).order() - 1) != (src2).dim((src2).order() - 1))) \
00274     ylerror("incompatible Idxs for eloop\n");                           \
00275   DimIter<type0> dst0(src0,(src0).order()-1);                           \
00276   DimIter<type1> dst1(src1,(src1).order()-1);                           \
00277   DimIter<type2> dst2(src2,(src2).order()-1);                           \
00278   for ( ; dst0.notdone(); ++dst0, ++dst1, ++dst2)
00279 
00280 #define idx_eloop4(dst0,src0,type0,dst1,src1,type1,                     \
00281                    dst2,src2,type2,dst3,src3,type3)                     \
00282   if (((src0).dim((src0).order() - 1) != (src1).dim((src1).order() - 1)) \
00283       || ((src0).dim((src0).order() - 1) != (src2).dim((src2).order() - 1)) \
00284       || ((src0).dim((src0).order() - 1) != (src3).dim((src3).order() - 1))) \
00285     ylerror("incompatible Idxs for eloop\n");                           \
00286   DimIter<type0> dst0(src0,(src0).order()-1);                           \
00287   DimIter<type1> dst1(src1,(src1).order()-1);                           \
00288   DimIter<type2> dst2(src2,(src2).order()-1);                           \
00289   DimIter<type3> dst3(src3,(src3).order()-1);                           \
00290   for ( ; dst0.notdone(); ++dst0, ++dst1, ++dst2, ++dst3)
00291 
00293   // aloop macros: loop over all elements of an Idx
00294   // These macros are somewhat inefficient and should be used as little
00295   // as possible, or whenever simplicity is preferable to speed.
00296 
00297   // Loops over all elements of an idx. This takes a pointer to
00298   // the data type of idx elements, and a blank IdxIter object:
00299   // idx_aloop1(data_pointer,idxiter,&idx) { do_stuff(data_pointer); }
00300   // Example of use: add 1 to all element of m:
00301   //  Idx<double> m(3,4);
00302   //  ScalarIter<double> p;
00303   //  idx_aloop1(p,&m) { *p += 1; }
00304 #define idx_aloop1_on(itr0,src0)                \
00305   for ( ; itr0.notdone(); ++itr0)
00306 
00307   // this loops simultaneously over all elements of 2 Idxs.
00308   // The two Idxs can have different structures as long as they have
00309   // the same total number of elements.
00310 #define idx_aloop2_on(itr0,src0,itr1,src1)      \
00311   idx_checknelems2_all(src0, src1);             \
00312   for ( ; itr0.notdone(); ++itr0, ++itr1)
00313 
00314 #define idx_aloop3_on(itr0,src0,itr1,src1,itr2,src2)    \
00315   idx_checknelems3_all(src0, src1, src2);               \
00316   for (; itr0.notdone(); ++itr0, ++itr1, ++itr2)
00317 
00318   // high level aloop macros.
00319   // These should be enclosed in braces, to avoid name clashes
00320 #define idx_aloop1(itr0,src0,type0)             \
00321   ScalarIter<type0> itr0(src0);                 \
00322   idx_aloop1_on(itr0,src0)
00323 
00324 #define idx_aloop2(itr0,src0,type0,itr1,src1,type1)     \
00325   ScalarIter<type0> itr0(src0);                         \
00326   ScalarIter<type1> itr1(src1);                         \
00327   idx_checknelems2_all(src0, src1);                     \
00328   for (; itr0.notdone(); ++itr0, ++itr1)
00329 
00330 #define idx_aloop3(itr0,src0,type0,itr1,src1,type1,itr2,src2,type2)     \
00331   ScalarIter<type0> itr0(src0);                                         \
00332   ScalarIter<type1> itr1(src1);                                         \
00333   ScalarIter<type2> itr2(src2);                                         \
00334   idx_checknelems3_all(src0, src1, src2);                               \
00335   for (; itr0.notdone(); ++itr0, ++itr1, ++itr2)
00336 
00338 #else
00340   //NO STL
00341 
00342 #define idx_bloop1(dst0,src0,type0)             \
00343   IdxLooper<type0> dst0(src0,0);                \
00344   for ( ; dst0.notdone(); dst0.next())
00345 
00346 #define idx_bloop2(dst0,src0,type0,dst1,src1,type1)     \
00347   idx_checkdim2_all(src0, src1, 0);                     \
00348   IdxLooper<type0> dst0(src0,0);                        \
00349   IdxLooper<type1> dst1(src1,0);                        \
00350   for ( ; dst0.notdone(); dst0.next(), dst1.next())
00351 
00352 #define idx_bloop3(dst0,src0,type0,dst1,src1,type1,dst2,src2,type2)     \
00353   idx_checkdim3_all(src0, src1, src2, 0);                               \
00354   IdxLooper<type0> dst0(src0,0);                                        \
00355   IdxLooper<type1> dst1(src1,0);                                        \
00356   IdxLooper<type2> dst2(src2,0);                                        \
00357   for ( ; dst0.notdone(); dst0.next(), dst1.next(), dst2.next())
00358 
00359 #define idx_bloop4(dst0,src0,type0,dst1,src1,type1,dst2,src2,type2,     \
00360                    dst3,src3,type3)                                     \
00361   idx_checkdim4_all(src0, src1, src2, src3, 0);                         \
00362   IdxLooper<type0> dst0(src0,0);                                        \
00363   IdxLooper<type1> dst1(src1,0);                                        \
00364   IdxLooper<type2> dst2(src2,0);                                        \
00365   IdxLooper<type3> dst3(src3,0);                                        \
00366   for ( ; dst0.notdone(); dst0.next(), dst1.next(), dst2.next(), dst3.next())
00367 
00368   // eloop macros
00369 
00370 #define idx_eloop1(dst0,src0,type0)             \
00371   IdxLooper<type0> dst0(src0,src0.order()-1);   \
00372   for ( ; dst0.notdone(); dst0.next())
00373 
00374 #define idx_eloop2(dst0,src0,type0,dst1,src1,type1)                     \
00375   if ((src0).dim((src0).order() - 1) != (src1).dim((src1).order() - 1)) \
00376     ylerror("incompatible Idxs for eloop\n");                           \
00377   IdxLooper<type0> dst0(src0,(src0).order()-1);                         \
00378   IdxLooper<type1> dst1(src1,(src1).order()-1);                         \
00379   for ( ; dst0.notdone(); dst0.next(), dst1.next())
00380 
00381 #define idx_eloop3(dst0,src0,type0,dst1,src1,type1,dst2,src2,type2)\
00382   if (((src0).dim((src0).order() - 1) != (src1).dim((src1).order() - 1)) \
00383       || ((src0).dim((src0).order() - 1) != (src2).dim((src2).order() - 1))) \
00384     ylerror("incompatible Idxs for eloop\n");                           \
00385   IdxLooper<type0> dst0(src0,(src0).order()-1);                         \
00386   IdxLooper<type1> dst1(src1,(src1).order()-1);                         \
00387   IdxLooper<type2> dst2(src2,(src2).order()-1);                         \
00388   for ( ; dst0.notdone(); dst0.next(), dst1.next(), dst2.next())
00389 
00390 #define idx_eloop4(dst0,src0,type0,dst1,src1,type1,                     \
00391                    dst2,src2,type2,dst3,src3,type3)                     \
00392   if (((src0).dim((src0).order() - 1) != (src1).dim((src1).order() - 1)) \
00393       || ((src0).dim((src0).order() - 1) != (src2).dim((src2).order() - 1)) \
00394       || ((src0).dim((src0).order() - 1) != (src3).dim((src3).order() - 1))) \
00395     ylerror("incompatible Idxs for eloop\n");                           \
00396   IdxLooper<type0> dst0(src0,(src0).order()-1);                         \
00397   IdxLooper<type1> dst1(src1,(src1).order()-1);                         \
00398   IdxLooper<type2> dst2(src2,(src2).order()-1);                         \
00399   IdxLooper<type3> dst3(src3,(src3).order()-1);                         \
00400   for ( ; dst0.notdone(); dst0.next(), dst1.next(), dst2.next(), dst3.next())
00401 
00403   // aloop macros: loop over all elements
00404 
00405   // Loops over all elements of an idx. This takes a pointer to
00406   // the data type of idx elements, and a blank IdxIter object:
00407   // idx_aloop1(data_pointer,idxiter,&idx) { do_stuff(data_pointer); }
00408   // Example of use: add 1 to all element of m:
00409   //  Idx<double> m(3,4);
00410   //  IdxIter<double> p;
00411   //  idx_aloop1(p,&m) { *p += 1; }
00412 #define idx_aloop1_on(itr0,src0)                        \
00413   for ( itr0.init(src0); itr0.notdone(); itr0.next())
00414 
00415   // this loops simultaneously over all elements of 2 Idxs.
00416   // The two Idxs can have different structures as long as they have
00417   // the same total number of elements.
00418 #define idx_aloop2_on(itr0,src0,itr1,src1)      \
00419   idx_checknelems2_all(src0, src1);             \
00420   for ( itr0.init(src0), itr1.init(src1);       \
00421         itr0.notdone();                         \
00422         itr0.next(), itr1.next())
00423 
00424 #define idx_aloop3_on(itr0,src0,itr1,src1,itr2,src2)            \
00425   idx_checknelems3_all(src0, src1, src2);                       \
00426   for (itr0.init(src0), itr1.init(src1), itr2.init(src2);       \
00427        itr0.notdone();                                          \
00428        itr0.next(), itr1.next(), itr2.next())
00429 
00430   // high level aloop macros.
00431   // These should be enclosed in braces, to avoid name clashes
00432 #define idx_aloop1(itr0,src0,type0)             \
00433   IdxIter<type0> itr0;                          \
00434   idx_aloop1_on(itr0,src0)
00435 
00436 #define idx_aloop2(itr0,src0,type0,itr1,src1,type1)     \
00437   IdxIter<type0> itr0;                                  \
00438   IdxIter<type1> itr1;                                  \
00439   idx_checknelems2_all(src0, src1);                     \
00440   for (itr0.init(src0), itr1.init(src1);                \
00441        itr0.notdone();                                  \
00442        itr0.next(), itr1.next())
00443 
00444 #define idx_aloop3(itr0,src0,type0,itr1,src1,type1,itr2,src2,type2)     \
00445   IdxIter<type0> itr0;                                                  \
00446   IdxIter<type1> itr1;                                                  \
00447   IdxIter<type2> itr2;                                                  \
00448   idx_checknelems3_all(src0, src1, src2);                               \
00449   for (itr0.init(src0), itr1.init(src1), itr2.init(src2);               \
00450        itr0.notdone();                                                  \
00451        itr0.next(), itr1.next(), itr2.next())
00452 
00453 #endif // if USING_STL_ITERS, else
00454 
00456   // Idx methods
00457 
00458   template <class T> void Idx<T>::growstorage() {
00459     if ( storage->growsize(spec.footprint()) < 0) {
00460       ylerror("cannot grow storage");
00461     }
00462   }
00463 
00464   template <class T> void Idx<T>::growstorage_chunk(intg s_chunk){
00465     if( storage->growsize_chunk(spec.footprint(), s_chunk) < 0) {
00466       ylerror("cannot grow storage");
00467     }
00468   }
00469 
00470   /* the constructor doesn't exist and I didn't find one to replace it
00471      template<typename T>
00472      void Idx<T>::printElems(FILE* filePtr){
00473      this->printElems(std::ofstream(filePtr));
00474      }
00475   */
00476 
00477   template <class T> Idx<T>::~Idx() {
00478     DEBUG("Idx::destructor %ld\n",long(this));
00479     storage->unlock();
00480   }

00482   // fake constructor called by IdxLooper constructor
00483   template <class T> Idx<T>::Idx(dummyt *dummy) {
00484     spec.dim = NULL;
00485     spec.mod = NULL;
00486     storage = NULL;
00487   }

00510     growstorage();
00511     storage->lock();
00512   }

00615   // resize methods
00616   
00617   template <class T> 
00618   intg Idx<T>::setoffset(intg o) {
00619     if (o<0) { ylerror("Idx::setoffset: offset must be positive"); }
00620     if (o > spec.offset) {
00621       spec.setoffset(o);
00622       growstorage();
00623       return o;
00624     } else {
00625       spec.setoffset(o);
00626       return o;
00627     }
00628   }
00629 
00630   template <class T> 
00631   void Idx<T>::resize(intg s0, intg s1, intg s2, intg s3, 
00632                                          intg s4, intg s5, intg s6, intg s7) {
00633     if (!same_dim(s0,s1,s2,s3,s4,s5,s6,s7)) { // save some time
00634       spec.resize(s0,s1,s2,s3,s4,s5,s6,s7);
00635       growstorage();
00636     }
00637   }
00638 
00639   template <class T> 
00640   void Idx<T>::resize(const IdxDim &d) {
00641     if (d.ndim > spec.ndim) ylerror("cannot change order of Idx in resize");
00642     if (!same_dim(d)) { // save some time if dims are same
00643       spec.resize(d);
00644       growstorage();
00645     }
00646   }
00647 
00648   template <class T> 
00649   void Idx<T>::resize1(intg dimn, intg size) {
00650     if (dimn > spec.ndim) ylerror("cannot change order of Idx in resize");
00651     if (spec.dim[dimn] != size) {
00652       spec.resize1(dimn, size);
00653       growstorage();
00654     }
00655   }
00656 
00657   template <class T> 
00658   void Idx<T>::resize_chunk(intg s_chunk, intg s0, intg s1, intg s2, intg s3, 
00659                             intg s4, intg s5, intg s6, intg s7) {
00660     spec.resize(s0,s1,s2,s3,s4,s5,s6,s7);
00661     growstorage_chunk(s_chunk);
00662   }
00663 
00664   // return true if this Idx has same order and dimensions as IdxDim d.
00665   // i.e. if all their dimensions are equal (regardless of strides).
00666   template <class T> 
00667   bool Idx<T>::same_dim(const IdxDim &d) {
00668     if (spec.ndim != d.ndim) 
00669       return false; 
00670     for (int i=0; i < spec.ndim; ++i)
00671       if (spec.dim[i] != d.dim[i]) 
00672         return false;
00673     return true;
00674   }
00675 
00676   // return true if this Idx has same order and dimensions s0 .. s7
00677   // i.e. if all their dimensions are equal (regardless of strides).
00678   template <class T> 
00679   bool Idx<T>::same_dim(intg s0, intg s1, intg s2, intg s3, intg s4, intg s5,
00680                          intg s6, intg s7) {
00681     if ((s7 >= 0) && (spec.ndim < 8)) return false;
00682     if ((spec.ndim == 8) && (s7 != spec.dim[7])) return false;
00683     if ((s6 >= 0) && (spec.ndim < 7)) return false;
00684     if ((spec.ndim >= 7) && (s6 != spec.dim[6])) return false;
00685     if ((s5 >= 0) && (spec.ndim < 6)) return false;
00686     if ((spec.ndim >= 6) && (s5 != spec.dim[5])) return false;
00687     if ((s4 >= 0) && (spec.ndim < 5)) return false;
00688     if ((spec.ndim >= 5) && (s4 != spec.dim[4])) return false;
00689     if ((s3 >= 0) && (spec.ndim < 4)) return false;
00690     if ((spec.ndim >= 4) && (s3 != spec.dim[3])) return false;
00691     if ((s2 >= 0) && (spec.ndim < 3)) return false;
00692     if ((spec.ndim >= 3) && (s2 != spec.dim[2])) return false;
00693     if ((s1 >= 0) && (spec.ndim < 2)) return false;
00694     if ((spec.ndim >= 2) && (s1 != spec.dim[1])) return false;
00695     if ((s0 >= 0) && (spec.ndim < 1)) return false;
00696     if ((spec.ndim >= 1) && (s0 != spec.dim[0])) return false;
00697     return true;
00698   }
00699 
00700   template <class T> IdxDim& Idx<T>::getIdxDim(IdxDim& d) {
00701     d.read(spec);
00702     return d;
00703   }
00704 
00706   // Idx manipulation methods
00707 
00708   template <class T> Idx<T> Idx<T>::select(int d, intg i) {
00709     Idx<T> r(storage,spec.getoffset());
00710     spec.select_into(&r.spec, d, i);
00711     return r;
00712   }
00713 
00714   template <class T> Idx<T> Idx<T>::narrow(int d, intg s, intg o) {
00715     Idx<T> r(storage,spec.getoffset());
00716     spec.narrow_into(&r.spec, d, s, o);
00717     return r;
00718   }
00719 
00720   template <class T> Idx<T> Idx<T>::transpose(int d1, int d2) {
00721     Idx<T> r(storage,spec.getoffset());
00722     spec.transpose_into(&r.spec, d1, d2);
00723     return r;
00724   }
00725 
00726   template <class T> Idx<T> Idx<T>::transpose(int *p) {
00727     Idx<T> r(storage,spec.getoffset());
00728     spec.transpose_into(&r.spec, p);
00729     return r;
00730   }
00731 
00732   template <class T> Idx<T> Idx<T>::unfold(int d, intg k, intg s) {
00733     Idx<T> r(storage,spec.getoffset());
00734     spec.unfold_into(&r.spec, d, k, s);
00735     return r;
00736   }
00737 
00738   template <class T> Idx<T> Idx<T>::view_as_order(int n) {
00739     if (n < 0) {
00740       ylerror("view_as_order: input dimension must be positive");
00741       return *this;
00742     }
00743     if (n == spec.ndim)
00744       return *this;
00745     else {
00746       if ((n == 1) && (spec.ndim == 1)) {
00747         // the order is already 1, do nothing and return current Idx.
00748         return *this; 
00749       }
00750       else if (n == 1) {
00751         // the order is not 1, check that data is contiguous and return 
00752         // a 1D Idx.
00753         idx_check_contiguous1(*this);
00754         Idx<T> r(getstorage(), 0, spec.nelements());
00755         return r;
00756       } 
00757       else if (n > spec.ndim) {
00758         intg *ldim = new intg[n];
00759         intg *lmod = new intg[n];
00760         memcpy(ldim, spec.dim, spec.ndim * sizeof (intg));
00761         memcpy(lmod, spec.mod, spec.ndim * sizeof (intg));
00762         for (int i = spec.ndim; i < n; ++i) {
00763           ldim[i] = 1;
00764           lmod[i] = 1;
00765         }
00766         Idx<T> r(getstorage(), spec.getoffset(), n, ldim, lmod);
00767         delete ldim;
00768         delete lmod;
00769         return r;
00770       }
00771       else {
00772         ylerror("view_as_order is not defined when n < current order");
00773         return *this;
00774       }
00775     }
00776   }
00777 
00779   // pointer access methods
00780 
00781   // get element of Idx1
00782   template <class T> T *Idx<T>::ptr(intg i0) {
00783     if (spec.ndim != 1) ylerror("not an Idx1");
00784     if ((i0 < 0) || (i0 >= spec.dim[0])) ylerror("index 0 out of bound");
00785     return storage->data + spec.offset + i0*spec.mod[0];
00786   }
00787 
00788   // get element of Idx2
00789   template <class T> T *Idx<T>::ptr(intg i0, intg i1) {
00790     if (spec.ndim != 2) ylerror("not an Idx2");
00791     if ((i0 < 0) || (i0 >= spec.dim[0])) ylerror("index 0 out of bound");
00792     if ((i1 < 0) || (i1 >= spec.dim[1])) ylerror("index 1 out of bound");
00793     return storage->data + spec.offset + i0*spec.mod[0] + i1*spec.mod[1];
00794   }
00795 
00796   // get element of Idx3
00797   template <class T> T *Idx<T>::ptr(intg i0, intg i1, intg i2) {
00798     if (spec.ndim != 3) ylerror("not an Idx3");
00799     if ((i0 < 0) || (i0 >= spec.dim[0])) ylerror("index 0 out of bound");
00800     if ((i1 < 0) || (i1 >= spec.dim[1])) ylerror("index 1 out of bound");
00801     if ((i2 < 0) || (i2 >= spec.dim[2])) ylerror("index 2 out of bound");
00802     return storage->data + spec.offset + i0*spec.mod[0] + i1*spec.mod[1] 
00803       + i2*spec.mod[2];
00804   }
00805 
00806   // return a pointer to an element of an Idx
00807   // generic function for order>3
00808   template <class T> T *Idx<T>::ptr(intg i0, intg i1, intg i2, intg i3, 
00809                                     intg i4, intg i5, intg i6, intg i7) {
00810     try {
00811       // check that we passed the right number of indices
00812       // and that they are all positive
00813       switch (spec.ndim) {
00814       case 8: if (i7 < 0) throw(-8);break;
00815       case 7: if ((i6 < 0) || (i7 != -1)) throw(-7);break;
00816       case 6: if ((i5 < 0) || (i6 != -1)) throw(-6);break;
00817       case 5: if ((i4 < 0) || (i5 != -1)) throw(-5);break;
00818       case 4: if ((i3<0)||(i2<0)||(i1<0)||(i0<0)||(i4 != -1)) throw(-4);break;
00819       default: throw(10);
00820       }
00821       // now compute offset, and check that all
00822       // indices are within bounds.
00823       intg k = 0;
00824       switch (spec.ndim) {
00825       case 8: k += spec.mod[7]*i7; if (i7 >= spec.dim[7])  throw(7);
00826       case 7: k += spec.mod[6]*i6; if (i6 >= spec.dim[6])  throw(6);
00827       case 6: k += spec.mod[5]*i5; if (i5 >= spec.dim[5])  throw(5);
00828       case 5: k += spec.mod[4]*i4; if (i4 >= spec.dim[4])  throw(4);
00829       case 4: k += spec.mod[3]*i3; if (i3 >= spec.dim[3])  throw(3);
00830       }
00831       k += spec.mod[2]*i2; if (i2 >= spec.dim[2])  throw(2);
00832       k += spec.mod[1]*i1; if (i1 >= spec.dim[1])  throw(1);
00833       k += spec.mod[0]*i0; if (i0 >= spec.dim[0])  throw(0);
00834       return storage->data + spec.offset + k;
00835     }
00836     catch(int k) {
00837       if (k==10) ylerror("Idx::get: number of indices and order are different");
00838       if (k < 0) {
00839         ylerror("Idx::get: wrong number of indices, or negative index");
00840       } else {
00841         ylerror("Idx::get: index out of bound");
00842       }
00843       return NULL;
00844     }
00845   }
00846 
00848   // get methods
00849 
00850   // get element of Idx0
00851   template <class T> T Idx<T>::get() {
00852     if (spec.ndim != 0) ylerror("not an Idx0");
00853     return (storage->data)[spec.offset];
00854   }
00855 
00856   // get element of Idx1
00857   template <class T> T Idx<T>::get(intg i0) {
00858     if (spec.ndim != 1) ylerror("not an Idx1");
00859     if ((i0 < 0) || (i0 >= spec.dim[0])) ylerror("index 0 out of bound");
00860     return (storage->data)[spec.offset + i0*spec.mod[0]];
00861   }
00862 
00863   // get element of Idx2
00864   template <class T> T Idx<T>::get(intg i0, intg i1) {
00865     if (spec.ndim != 2) ylerror("not an Idx2");
00866     if ((i0 < 0) || (i0 >= spec.dim[0])) ylerror("index 0 out of bound");
00867     if ((i1 < 0) || (i1 >= spec.dim[1])) ylerror("index 1 out of bound");
00868     return (storage->data)[spec.offset + i0*spec.mod[0] + i1*spec.mod[1]];
00869   }
00870 
00871   // get element of Idx3
00872   template <class T> T Idx<T>::get(intg i0, intg i1, intg i2) {
00873     if (spec.ndim != 3) ylerror("not an Idx3");
00874     if ((i0 < 0) || (i0 >= spec.dim[0])) ylerror("index 0 out of bound");
00875     if ((i1 < 0) || (i1 >= spec.dim[1])) ylerror("index 1 out of bound");
00876     if ((i2 < 0) || (i2 >= spec.dim[2])) ylerror("index 2 out of bound");
00877     return (storage->data)[spec.offset + i0*spec.mod[0] + i1*spec.mod[1] 
00878                            + i2*spec.mod[2]];
00879   }
00880 
00881   // get element of an Idx of any order
00882   template <class T> T Idx<T>::get(intg i0, intg i1, intg i2, intg i3, 
00883                                    intg i4, intg i5, intg i6, intg i7) {
00884     return *ptr(i0,i1,i2,i3,i4,i5,i6,i7);
00885   }

00888   // set methods
00889 
00890   // set the element of Idx0
00891   template <class T> T Idx<T>::set(T val) {
00892     if (spec.ndim != 0) ylerror("not an Idx0");
00893     return (storage->data)[spec.offset] = val;
00894   }
00895 
00896   // set the element of Idx1
00897   template <class T> T Idx<T>::set(T val, intg i0) {
00898     if (spec.ndim != 1) ylerror("not an Idx1");
00899     if ((i0 < 0) || (i0 >= spec.dim[0])) ylerror("index 0 out of bound");
00900     return (storage->data)[spec.offset + i0*spec.mod[0]] = val;
00901   }
00902 
00903   // set the element of Idx2
00904   template <class T> T Idx<T>::set(T val, intg i0, intg i1) {
00905     if (spec.ndim != 2) ylerror("not an Idx2");
00906     if ((i0 < 0) || (i0 >= spec.dim[0])) ylerror("index 0 out of bound");
00907     if ((i1 < 0) || (i1 >= spec.dim[1])) ylerror("index 1 out of bound");
00908     return (storage->data)[spec.offset + i0*spec.mod[0] + i1*spec.mod[1]] = val;
00909   }
00910 
00911   // set the element of Idx3
00912   template <class T> T Idx<T>::set(T val, intg i0, intg i1, intg i2) {
00913     if (spec.ndim != 3) ylerror("not an Idx3");
00914     if ((i0 < 0) || (i0 >= spec.dim[0])) ylerror("index 0 out of bound");
00915     if ((i1 < 0) || (i1 >= spec.dim[1])) ylerror("index 1 out of bound");
00916     if ((i2 < 0) || (i2 >= spec.dim[2])) ylerror("index 2 out of bound");
00917     return (storage->data)[spec.offset + i0*spec.mod[0] + i1*spec.mod[1] 
00918                            + i2*spec.mod[2]] = val;
00919   }
00920 
00921   // set an element of an Idx of any order.
00922   template <class T> T Idx<T>::set(T val, intg i0, intg i1, intg i2, intg i3, 
00923                                    intg i4, intg i5, intg i6, intg i7) {
00924     return *ptr(i0,i1,i2,i3,i4,i5,i6,i7) = val;
00925   }
00926 
00928   // print methods
00929 
00930   template <typename T>
00931   void Idx<T>::printElems( std::ostream& out ){
00932     printElems_impl(0, out);
00933   }
00934 
00935   template <typename T>
00936   void Idx<T>::printElems(){
00937     this->printElems( std::cout );
00938   }
00939 
00940   template<class T> inline T printElems_impl_cast(T val) {
00941     return val;
00942   }
00943 
00944   // specialization for ubyte to print as unsigned integers.
00945   inline unsigned int printElems_impl_cast(ubyte val) {
00946     return (unsigned int) val;
00947   }
00948 
00949   template <typename T>
00950   void Idx<T>::printElems_impl( int indent, std::ostream& out ) {
00951     static const std::string lbrace = "[";
00952     static const std::string rbrace = "]";
00953     static const std::string sep = " ";
00954     std::ostringstream oss;
00955     for( unsigned int ii = 0; ii < lbrace.length(); ++ii ) {
00956       oss<<" ";
00957     }
00958     const std::string tab(oss.str());
00959 
00960     // printing a 0-dimensional tensor
00961     if( order() == 0 ){
00962       out<<lbrace<<"@"<<sep<< printElems_impl_cast(get()) <<sep<<rbrace<<"\n";
00963     }
00964     // printing a 1-D tensor
00965     else if( order() == 1 ){
00966       out<<lbrace<<sep;
00967       for( int ii = 0; ii < dim(0); ++ii ){
00968         out<< printElems_impl_cast(get(ii)) <<sep;
00969       }
00970       out<<rbrace<<"\n";
00971     }
00972     // printing a multidimensional tensor
00973     else{
00974 
00975       // opening brace
00976       out<<lbrace;
00977 
00978       // print subtensors.
00979       Idx<T> subtensor(storage, spec.offset);
00980       for( int dimInd = 0; dimInd < dim(0); ++dimInd ){
00981 
00982         // only print indent if this isn't the first subtensor.
00983         if( dimInd > 0 ){
00984           for( int ii = 0; ii < indent+1; ++ii ){
00985             out<<(tab);
00986           }
00987         }
00988 
00989         // print subtensor
00990         spec.select_into(&subtensor.spec, 0, dimInd);
00991         subtensor.printElems_impl( indent+1, out );
00992 
00993         // only print the newline if this isn't the last subtensor.
00994         if( dimInd < (dim(0)-1)){
00995           out<<"\n";
00996         }
00997       }
00998       // closing brace
00999       out<<rbrace<<"\n";
01000     }
01001   }
01002 
01003   template <class T> void Idx<T>::pretty(FILE *f) {
01004     fprintf(f,"Idx: at address %ld\n",(intg)this);
01005     fprintf(f,"  storage=%ld (size=%ld)\n",(intg)storage,storage->size());
01006     spec.pretty(f);
01007   }
01008 
01009   template <class T> void Idx<T>::pretty(std::ostream& out){
01010     out << "Idx: at address " << (intg)this << "\n";
01011     out << "  storage=" <<  (intg)storage << "(size=" << storage->size();
01012     out << "\n";
01013     spec.pretty(out);
01014   }
01015 
01016   template <class T> int Idx<T>::fdump(FILE *f) {
01017     if (spec.ndim == 0) {
01018       std::ostringstream oss;
01019       // fprintf(f,"[@ %g]\n",this->get());
01020       oss << "[@ " << this->get() << "]\n";
01021       fputs(oss.str().data(), f);
01022     } else if (spec.ndim == 1) {
01023       std::ostringstream oss;
01024       // fprintf(f,"[");
01025       oss << "[";
01026       for (intg i=0; i<dim(0); i += mod(0)) {
01027         // fprintf(f,"%g ",(storage->data)[spec.offset + i]);
01028         oss << (storage->data)[spec.offset + i] << " ";
01029       }
01030       // fprintf(f,"]\n");
01031       oss << "]\n";
01032       fputs(oss.str().data(), f);
01033     } else {
01034       fprintf(f,"[");
01035       { idx_bloop1(p,*this,T) { p.fdump(f); } }
01036       fprintf(f,"]\n");
01037     }
01038     return 0;
01039   }
01040

01084 #if USING_STL_ITERS == 0
01086   // an IdxLooper is an iterator for Idxs.
01087   // It is actually a subclass of Idx.
01088   // These are not C++ iterators in the classical sense.
01089 
01090   template <class T> 
01091   IdxLooper<T>::IdxLooper(Idx<T> &idx, int ld) : Idx<T>((dummyt*)0) {
01092     i = 0;
01093     dimd = idx.spec.dim[ld];
01094     modd = idx.spec.mod[ld];
01095     idx.spec.select_into(&(this->spec), ld, i);
01096     this->storage = idx.storage;
01097     this->storage->lock();
01098   }
01099 
01100   // like ++
01101   // CAUTION: this doesn't do array bound checking
01102   // because we coudn't use a for loop if it did.
01103   template <class T> T *IdxLooper<T>::next() {
01104     i++;
01105     this->spec.offset += modd;
01106     return this->storage->data + this->spec.offset;
01107   }
01108 
01109   // return true when done.
01110   template <class T> bool IdxLooper<T>::notdone() { return ( i < dimd ); }
01111 
01113   // a pointer that loops over all elements
01114   // of an Idx
01115 
01116   // empty constructor;
01117   template <class T> IdxIter<T>::IdxIter() { }
01118 
01119   template <class T> T *IdxIter<T>::init(Idx<T> &idx) {
01120     iterand = &idx;
01121     i = 0;
01122     j = iterand->spec.ndim;
01123     data = iterand->storage->data + iterand->spec.offset;
01124     if (iterand->spec.contiguousp()) {
01125       d[0] = -1;
01126     } else {
01127       for(int i=0; i < iterand->spec.ndim; i++) { d[i] = 0; }
01128     }
01129     n = iterand->spec.nelements();
01130     return data;
01131   }
01132 
01133   template <class T> T *IdxIter<T>::next() {
01134     i++;
01135     if (d[0] < 0) {
01136       // contiguous Idx
01137       data++;
01138     } else {
01139       // non-contiguous Idx
01140       j--;
01141       do {
01142         if (j<0) break;
01143         if (++d[j] < iterand->spec.dim[j]) {
01144           data += iterand->spec.mod[j];
01145           j++;
01146         } else {
01147           data -= iterand->spec.dim[j] * iterand->spec.mod[j];
01148           d[j--] = -1;
01149         }
01150       } while (j < iterand->spec.ndim);
01151     }
01152     return data;
01153   }
01154 
01155   template <class T> bool IdxIter<T>::notdone() { return ( i < n ); }
01156 
01157 #endif // IF USING_STL_ITERS == 0
01158 
01159 } // namespace ebl
01160 
01161 #endif
